dataIdInfo.envirDesc: Microsoft Windows Server 2008 R2 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.2.1.3588
dataIdInfo.idPurp: General Query, cartographics, and identification of all areas in the Louisville metropolitan area where fixed-route transit routes exist. Not set up for routing or network purposes.
dataIdInfo.idAbs:
The TARC.Fixed_Route dataset contains all fixed routes serving the Louisville metropolitan regional area. One shape and one corresponding record exist for each individual transit route.

The routes reflect routing changes and additions for the schedule beginning August 21, 2016.

usrDefFreq.duration: No more than three times a year (January, June, and August), when the TARC service schedule changes.

LegConsts.othConsts: Data access is restricted to LOJIC Participants, contractors, and Licensees only.

Consts.useLimit: LIMITATION OF LIABILITY: The participants of the Louisville/Jefferson County Information Consortium have no indication or reason to believe that there are any inaccuracies or defects of information incorporated in this work and make NO REPRESENTATIONS OF ANY KIND, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY OR FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR USE, NOR ARE ANY SUCH WARRANTIES TO BE IMPLIED, WITH RESPECT TO THE INFORMATION OR DATA, FURNISHED HEREIN.

dataIdInfo.suppInfo:
The TARC.Fixed_Route dataset contains all fixed routes serving the Louisville metropolitan regional area. One shape and one corresponding record exist for each individual transit route.
The routes reflect routing changes and additions for the schedule beginning August 21, 2016.
Lines were obtained from Remix. This application uses TARC's route data via Google's General Transit Feed Specification (GTFS), which originates from Trapeze transit software. These lines are derived from street centerlines. The fields of ROUTE_NUMBER and ROUTE_NAME were created from the original fields. ROUTE_TYPE and TARC_WEB fields were created to assist consumers of the data.

enttyp.enttypd: Line feature class of August 2016 TARC bus routes

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef:
A description of the type of route.
Local - Routes that involve frequent stops and consequent low speeds, the purpose of which is to deliver and pick up transit passengers as close to their destinations or origins as possible.
Express - Routes generally connecting residential areas and activity centers via a high speed, non-stop connection, e.g., a freeway, or exclusive right-of-way such as a dedicated busway with limited stops at each end for collection and distribution. Residential collection can be exclusively or partially undertaken using park-and-ride facilities.
Circulator - Routes that provide a connecting link between urban local routes, and many times serve as suburban circulators.
An identifier of the route commonly associated with major streets or areas that form a major portion of the route.
A link to the TARC website showing map and schedule information for each route.
